title: Immigrant-owned businesses on rise
body:
Coming Sunday

Whether out of necessity or the desire to carve out their versions of the American Dream, more immigrants to the 
U.S. are opting to launch new businesses rather than work for existing companies. In fact, studies suggest that in 
2010, foreign-born entrepreneurs were twice as likely to start their own businesses than their American-born 
counterparts. Although ranking behind gateway states such as Florida and California, Georgia is experiencing a 
rising trend of immigrant-owned companies. A study shows Georgia had the fifth-highest rate of immigrant-
owned startups by 2007, the latest data available.
